discussion.author: hivert
discussion.comment:
Excellent ! While you are at it, I'd like to be able to write something like:
```
Variable (u : unit) (Ord : orderType u).
Let OrdC := [orderType of Ord^c].
```
However the notation `Ord^c` is not defined.

[edit]I was using an old version of the file but even with the new one:
```
From mathcomp Require Import all_ssreflect.
From mathcomp Require Import boolp.

Require Import order.


Set Implicit Arguments.
Unset Strict Implicit.
Unset Printing Implicit Defensive.

Import Order.Syntax.
Import Order.TTheory.
Open Scope order_scope.

Section Dual.

Variable (u : unit) (Ord : orderType u).

Let OrdC := [orderType of Ord^c].
```
gives: 
```
Error: The reference c was not found in the current environment.
```
It seems to be defined only locally. Or is there a problem with my install ?

discussion.author: hivert
discussion.comment:
> `^c` was renamed to `^d`

It doesn't work for me with the updated version.

```
From mathcomp Require Import all_ssreflect.
From mathcomp Require Import boolp.

Require Import order.


Set Implicit Arguments.
Unset Strict Implicit.
Unset Printing Implicit Defensive.

Import Order.Syntax.
Import Order.TTheory.
Open Scope order_scope.

Section Dual.

Variable (u : unit) (Ord : orderType u).

Let OrdC := [orderType of Ord^d].
```
Gives:
```
Error: The reference d was not found in the current environment.
```
Maybe I didn't export the right module or the right scope. See my precise example above...

discussion.author: hivert
discussion.comment:
It seems that it is only defined as a local notation:
```
Local Notation "T ^d" := (dual T) (at level 2, format "T ^d") : type_scope.
```

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
> It seems that it is only defined as a local notation:

oh, right, should be fixed now

discussion.author: hivert
discussion.comment: Excellent ! These missing canonicals seem to fix all my issues ! Thanks for the extremely quick fix.

Renaming converse to dual in order.v

Indeed, the name converse and notation ^c were already taken in
https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/blob/master/mathcomp/algebra/ssralg.v#L989-L990
We are renaming to dual.
